1tlKHzalDLApOS6kyQ44IA.text: Nice pub, good meeting place near to London Bridge Tube and Borough Market. Service is pretty slow though.

photos.caption: Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom

BEEvTKkkYRAavoq-wKeY9w.text: I do love this place with its eclectic mix of people and the vast array of unusual premium beers and ciders. The reviews below say it well!

SeY3tV1CDjcsxEI9VvrXiA.text: One of my favourite places to go for Sunday dinner especially if you can get a booth downstairs. I like Cell no 2 best. The brownie is excellent too.

xKK3fYw1Xw5VXYK8hiUkng.text: Ostensibly this place is a dump.  I walked in here thinking I just landed in a landfill.  The interior is all dark and dusty, there are stupid little fairy lights hanging around the windows and the bark on the wooden tables looked like they were termite-ridden.  Hanging out here for a few hours completely disproved my initial assumptions about the Southwark Tavern.  It can actually be a lot of fun.  The food is cheap (£6 for a good meal), the drinks are cheap (£3 or less for a pint), so what if the décor isn't the pinnacle of modern design?

photos.caption: Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom

-dNKw-ivGFfrIICMrQNFjg.text: This is a great place, good music and a good atmosphere. Always busy

cYgxuPOrBXJW1pE-OEkdPw.text: I think the other reviewer encapsulated it perfectly in saying 'a good bar when it's not too busy'. On the plus side, it feels like a traditional pub, with lots of wood and an island counter at ground level. There are plenty of chairs and tables (more on this later) and they serve real ale, which seems well enough kept - I suspect turnover is pretty fast, which helps. Not a bad choice of beers, either. The downside is that it gets horribly busy in the period after work, between 5pm and 7pm. It became a bit of a squash to move about and I found groups of people getting quite territorial 'saving' chairs for friends who didn't turn up for half an hour, that sort of thing: we've all done it, I suspect, but when it's this busy and their friends haven't arrived, I'd be embarrassed to bag the furniture for this long. Service also slowed up somewhat at the bar. My real disappointment was, however, with the food. They didn't have my first two choices, so my third choice was chicken salad with avocado. The chicken was a bit tough, but OK, but worst was the avocado: it was clearly not ripe, and had the texture of hard rubber. You couldn't cut it, never mind eat it. Not good enough for £7. It was also slow arriving, but they warned me about that. I would have complained at the time, but it was so busy that it was not conducive to such a conversation, so I just cut my losses and left. There are several other pubs around, so this wouldn't be my first choice - and I'd eat somewhere else.

lOvMPEObaysGJCKGJ6JK6w.text: Good food, good beer (although very expensive), you could do worse than the Southwark Tavern. The booths downstairs are a nice place for a catch up if you can get one. The bar is split over two floors and overlooks one corner of Borough Market.

P5Szsrqxs_nS2ChNGbm4qA.text: Had a top night out doing their pub quiz in the downstairs bar on a Tuesday night. Busy, but great Quiz Master and atmosphere. Worth checking out. Started just after 8pm but recommend you get there a bit earlier to grab a table or one of their cellar booths.

or1iCayG-h7K14ThP4gkRg.text: if you are looking for a traditional British pub here it is! I'm really not a fan of old dirty pubs with a bunch of guys drinking beers not my idea of fun...but if you wonder all the way down stairs you can find little nook and crannies in the cellar. I found it quintessentially British and European to be sipping wine or beer in a brick cellar under the street. Ive read some reviews claiming this place was once a jail...if that's true... I like this place even more. Yes it gets crowded but that is usual for a neighborhood pubs, at least you can try to find a place to sit and enjoy your drink...

jM6nLS3rh_-6OxF25OrPmw.text: Southwark Tavern's golden woods, unique square bar, and affable bartenders are incredibly welcoming, and will render you indisposed for hours. One evening, the Tavern's infectious jovial atmosphere persuaded me to do a series of shots and then throw back two car bombs (a full pint of Guinness with two shots of Bailey's) in quick succession, to the delight of my fellow patrons. I subsequently tripped along some cobbled streets to a bench that afforded a view of St. Paul's and listened to the river lap against the embankment walls for an hour. Then I started whining for a chicken curry, and became inconsolable when I found that the shop near the tube that sold my beloved Cadbury snacks had closed for the evening. Southwark Tavern easily lends itself to a cheap, fun night of boozing, and I wouldn't trade that night for anything.

2vQbV5H0yt4_jKtPRlyBUA.text: One of my favourite London bars and been many times. Love the little cellars downstairs and the mix of office workers and locals, I even saw Trigger in here one evening! Good selection of beers and some pub games to play. Only thing stopping it getting a 5 is that on a Thurs and Fri night can be a nightmare getting to the bat as so busy. A must visit though.

cZjcwk_OyN33scE6tLPDmg.text: Recently spruced up bar right next to Borough Market. Food come very well reccomended. The cells downstairs are a great addition to what is an awesome pub.

AmyKQxf2lRbHpFuJq29xLQ.text: The real highlight of this traditional stylee pub is the basement area where the old cells have been converted into booths. Very cosy! The food is good, although a bit pricey and not very quick to get to you. A good selection of beers at above average prices.

Kq9KYLWyWX6H4puPgc-QWw.text: Okay, so perhaps The Southwark Tavern didn't have the first two ales I tried to order in stock. But once the charming lady behind the bar had made the apologies, I went on to order a Sunday Roast and settled in the corner with my friend (an actual human, not the pint of Cask Ale).The food turned up 20 minutes later, and my Half Roast Chicken came complete with potatoes, roast vegetables, Yorkshire Pud and copious amounts of gravy - but the Chicken (which, lets face it, is all anybody really cares about in a Roast) was juicy, tender and very tasty.I'd like to think that a good Roast Chicken isn't too difficult to get wrong, but more often than not, the chicken turns up dry, flaky and I end up ordering extra gravy just to get through the whole darn meal.All kudos to The Southwark Tavern - for a gastropub meal, this was a fine Roast, and I'll happily pop by for another (and hopefully completed with my first choice ale!)

WYzDkWC6n_MuB_JbxvbYsQ.text: Pork Belly....Sierra Nevada...A Dungeon...Life doesnt get much better...Feels like a nice local that you can take someone on a business lunch or a beautiful pub lunch.Gold

photos.caption: Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Pork Belly
Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Pork Belly

WDig0HdVBjae_P3H_PK72g.text: Its location near London Bridge is perfect for an after work pint - or in my case on the way back to my hotel. It seems like a great neighborhood pub, perfect for meeting up with friends or just to have a pint. They have 3 or 4 different TVs making it a great place to watch Olympic events. It's also at the beginning of Borough Market so if you have a few, there are places to grab chips nearby. The people are friendly, too.

-IGWtajNyKdJ_wBxqTG3ag.text: Great location for this pub (just a bit south from London Bridge, on the corner at Stony St. right next to Borough Market. Had an interesting beer, here, Stonehenge Eye Catcher, but tended to gravitate back to the more traditional London ales. Good service during the afternoon (both at the bar and at the table) at midday when the place was a little less crowded.  It gets hectic later on, though. The afterwork crowd fills the place later on making the service understandably less reliable. Food is pub classics, mediocre, but what you want in a pub. Great place for a pint off Borough Market if you're headed this way for the day.I was a tourist here but felt like I was treated as a regular, so that scores high in my book.

pnTa3kgicVyI6KS5eVzXyw.text: Unfriendly bartender, closed earlier than the posted time

oTk-zGUmsvV6SQl5E62zUg.text: The basement cells here are very cool, although actually being trapped next to a cell with a loud, drunk and obnoxious occupant was a little taste of real prison! That didn't spoil my enjoyment of this pub though, which I generally really liked. The prix fixe menu for £10 is excellent value and unlike a lot of prix fixe menus actually has some interesting options. I had whitebait to start which was great but unfortunately the minute steak was overcooked (both mine and my friend's) so overall I'd have to give 3 stars. Would come back though, and maybe try a less risky dish.

5DvdRMp-erGpBTmeUB5nhw.text: Ok, here is how we stumbled on this place.We tubed it out (is that a phrase?) to the Borough Market and it turned out to be closed.  Womp womp.  As we were walking around it anyway, I saw this unsuspecting spot on the corner and it was rather full.  Were they tourists?  Probably.  Was I hungry?  Definitely.They have a pretty impressive beer selection.  I went with a nice bitter or ipa called the Reviver.  It was pretty light bodied, low alcohol and with a nice hop presence.Our meals were the 21 day age West Country Beef and the Roasted Loin of Norfolk Pork.  Both dishes were garnished the same way, broccoli, carrots and roasted potatoes which were quite delicious.  I really enjoyed the sage jelly that came with my pork and the meal was certainly substantial.  I definitely enjoyed the pork more than the beef.The pub itself is quite cavernous and the service was rather good.  It's certainly a decent place to sit for a pint and a bite.

J83cyrDFrlmn7BKmsyvkgA.text: Great neighborhood tavern. Good beer selection, tasty food. I wandered into this place by chance while killing some time before meeting friends. The staff are friendly and the place is clearly popular with the locals.You'd have to stay for hours to make your way through all the local beer/ale options.My only complaint is the same complaint that most would have with the majority of London pubs...the restrooms stink. This is more of a complaint with London as a whole. You'd think this world capital would have figured out urinals and sewage by now.

8pgTKNvILWwbEfVTEEJ4Vg.text: Totally decent food (but the steak was cold, and the mash on the side of my otherwise solid braised lamb had that slightly nuclear heat of the microwave)An excellent beer selection-- shedloads of ales on tap... but then what's with those prices? £3.75 for bottles of crappy mexican lager? £4.75 for Sierra Nevada? I know it's an import, but seriously. Yeah, you're in zone 1. Suck it.Somewhat cluless barman on one side of the bar (but props and cheers to the guy who pointed out he wasn't serving in the order arrived)Very cool downstairs with cells in the cellarToo many fecking people in a too small space (but then it was wet and dreary and December)I like the place. I want to love it. The quiz was an awful lot of fun, even if I only joined in so I could keep my table and eat my food. I just can't love it. And I think it's because it's got all the earmarks of what's going wrong with Borough Market.  Which is the price of success, I suppose, and I accept it.But I don't have to love it.All that being said... I'd come back here. But probably just to drink. And wouldn't go out of my way for it (though I work awfully close by, so...)

Gw5qAY-CgukyTOTNDqpbJQ.text: Dozens of nooks and crannies, with exposed brickwork aplenty at this lovely pub adjacent to Borough market. Here's eight good reasons to venture down on a Saturday: - Open from 10am serving breakfast and beer- Gourmet Sausages and mash served all day- Five secret booths to escape the hustle and bustle of the market- DJs from 8pm- 21 ice cold draught beers and 18 ciders - Gorgeous home-made burgers- Both bars open all day - Open til 1am Need any further convincing? Thought not, just best get there early as devout locals jostle for position.

photos.caption: Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom

UiupbOvcpATCHUMhKL9YXQ.text: A ok pub, right by London Bridge and Borough Market.Good for an evening drink but I wouldn't recommend the food! It looked like it had been hanging around for a while. I had Salmon Fishcakes with potato wedges, there was nothing particularly awful about the meal, but there was nothing great about it either!When I arrived I asked the waiter if it was ok to move a table and he was pretty rude about it! Think needs a bit of an attitude check.

Azo3CJjwRZ2BJ5a4Lbw9Jg.text: Congrats Southark Tavern, two nights in a row, and you get four stars.Sure, I had to remind you to cook my sausages and hour after I ordered them, and sure you were out of every cask beer the first time I went there.  More than made up for it with your triple chocaholic stout and your generous samples of any beer that I enquired after.Stil the food is really good, the afformentioned sausage, fish and chips, and steak and chicken pies were all excellent and affordable, especially given the location.Nice feel to the place and it's huge without being overwhelming.  Having Animal Collective on the overheads when we walked in didn't hurt either.

rGBYrg34Fh-45VT6qGP4FQ.text: Located on the ever bustling Borough market, the Southwark Tavern is also a very lively pub and encourages a crowd of young professionals - especially on a post work Friday night drink. The actual building itself is beautiful and has been renovated to create a trendy yet unpretentious feel to the place. As with its neighbour the Market Porter, due to lack of inside seating, everyone tends to pile outside onto the street which is nice in the summer but not so great in the winter. The pub has a good range of beers such as Leffe Belgian beer and the bar staff are young and friendly. As for the food, I wasn't really very impressed as it is expensive for what you get and you tend to wait....and wait....and wait for it to arrive. It is one of the more sociable pubs that I have been to however, and because it gets busy so quickly, you do find yourself chatting to people whilst waiting to get served at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom

DaBYvdcJxu2k8xhKZl-NsQ.text: My biggest regret in London?  Getting to the Borough Market late on a Thursday, feeling the sting of being tardy to a foodie party, then making a feeble attempt at drowning my sorrows in a pint and eating in a pub.  Eating in a pub?  What was I thinking?It was my first day in London, we all make mistakes.  I loved the comfy booths and couches downstairs, but I didn't love the fish and chips and mushy peas I ordered.  We quickly learned that pubs are for drinking beer and socializing with good friends (and strangers).  Nothing less and nothing more.  This place gets crowded, so get there early to claim your spot.Leave the food up to the legendary Borough market across the street.

bVs5e5ToO6eIsMqiRB-low.text: Went there for a drink with friends on a Saturday night. Typical pub. I just wish they could have poured in more vodka in the glass...

In4ybGD-thFuEmV3r-aaKA.text: A solid, reliable place to go. You won't be wowed but you won't feel like you strolled into a tourist trap.I've been here about 3 times in the last year and while nothing has blown me away, the quality has been quite reasonable. The staff have been attentive and good humoured which can't always be easy judging by how packed it can get. Good beer selection. Not too hammy and pretentious. The food is good. Again, not life changing but reliable. Fish isn't overcooked. Chips were a little dry. Sausage and mash hit the spot... the chocolate and salted caramel tart is definitely one of the reasons I keep going back, it's probably not even all that fancy but it's delicious. The only thing it fails at is being standout. Had you put this a mile or so north in the middle of dodgy-Wetherspoons territory there'd be another star here. However set against the backdrop of Borough Market it seems to pale a little. On the doorstep of some fantastic producers and truly unique offerings it just doesn't seem enough for this pub to be plodding along the way it does. Perhaps it just needs to have a little confidence and show off. Put it this way: it's opposite the Brindisa tapas restaurant. It needs to up its game. It's almost there, it's just got to catch up with everything around it.

1ahxaoPOyI52YJFFoDPoag.text: Located a short walk from the ever-popular Borough Market, The Southwark Tavern attracts a mixed crowd of shoppers, students, professionals and locals.  On the weekends especially this place will be filled to overflowing so if you're looking for a quiet drinking spot then this probably isn't the place.  Those who brave the crowds will find themselves in a traditional/trendy bar sporting comfy sofas, lots of original features and a gorgeous square bar.  Set over two floors the upstairs is a more standard pub environment while the downstairs space provides an intimate nightspot with lots of hidey holes and corners.The atmosphere here is always top-notch and a constant buzz surround the place spurred on in part by the excellent food and drinks available.The menu is packed with a variety of gastropub cuisine with a leaning towards traditional English cooking albeit prepared with some very fine ingredients from the nearby marketplace.Drinks-wise there is a massive range of bottled and draught lager available as well as a good variety of wines and spirits which, like the food, come in at very reasonable prices.A great place to stop in pre or post-shop.  Not too sure what the evenings are like here but The Southwark Tavern strikes me as a place that caters more to afternoon and early evening drinkers and diners.

photos.caption: Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom

W9bxruuGYBq3BY6py_yKJQ.text: The Southwark Tavern is an unusual but popular bar on the edge of Borough Market. They serve decent beers, including Budvar, Staropramen, and Früli, plus an interesting range of bottled beers. Upstairs can feel a little cramped, as there is not much seating or standing area, and it always seems to be pretty full even early on in the week. It can take a while to get served at the bar. Downstairs there are some larger tables, and also a series of what seems like prison cells! Each one of these cells has a table and seating for about 8 people, which can be a lot of fun if you are able to get one. The food is a little expensive, but pretty good. I've only ordered food once on a Friday lunchtime, and it took over 45 minutes to arrive, although we were warned that this would be the case beforehand. A good bar when it's not too busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom

I-3FPsgznrO_WL8J2GOI-w.text: my friends and i stopped in here after a morning/afternoon spent in borough market. we were pretty happy to discover the small cells downstairs and at the back of the pub, which we tucked ourselves in to for an early afternoon bevvy and catch up (since we all hadn't been together for quite some time!)the bar staff left us alone, which we appreciated, and the drinks were fine - moderately priced. it was pretty quiet when we were in there - i like this in a pub, but i know that some people prefer it to be busier for a more bustling atmosphere. i would return if i was in the area, mainly because it is a nice inoffensive pub, and i'm not too familiar with any other pubs in the area which would be worth seeking out!

EmzNxh6Zc0NCBpLp9cmf4Q.text: Great location on the corner opposite Brindisa. Good selection of beers but avoid the food as it's very patchy and can be just awful. Recomended for a drink but head elsewhere for food.

EqRD08Vtak5K-e8nFcnbaw.text: This place has a cool vibe to it and has great food selection for vegetarians and a pretty vast beer menu. I ordered the vegetarian lasagna and it was some of the better lasagnas I've had. They put small bread crumbs on the top of it which mix well with the sauce and the cheese and give it more of a complete taste. It is not too cheesy which is great and the sauce doesn't overmix well with the rest of the dish. I'm not a huge fan of the vegetables but the grilled zucchini and squash were pretty good and even better with the lasagna.

photos.caption: Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Vegetarian Lasagna

TiiG3UvVqQAPAp2Ch5vUAA.text: I liked this pub. We stopped here for Sunday roast. There's seating both upstairs and downstairs. There's a good selection of beers. I had the roast beef for dinner. The beef was cooked perfectly. It came with a good selection of vegetables and a crunchy popover. They also have chicken roast as well. It was a good stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Sunday roast

0EYZuTYEJcLIiS6kdgqyZw.text: Mitch makes every little thing a perfect London Tavern experience. It's like the family experience you always want to have with ale to make it even better. Go here. And ask for Mitch.

UGjlPeckyFbZtMAEOcHVJA.text: I loved this place.  We visited on a busy market Saturday, and every place we considered was packed with people.  So was the Southwark, but they have this cute underground dining area that had tables available.  So we sat down.The tavern itself is just like many others, with the old styling and the selection of beers.  On this day, at least 50 people were spilled out on to the street and many more inside.  This isn't uncommon, but most taverns weren't offering food and the Southwark was.If you do go for a bite to eat, head for the downstairs.  It's like a dungeon, and set up like an old jail from the middle ages.  Maybe it actually WAS an old jail, I don't know.  But they have these alcoves with booth seating right down there, as well as several tables and a fireplace.  What a great atmosphere, and a really cool find considering we were literally wandering the streets.Their fish & chips was simply scrumptious.  No visit to London is proper without having fish & chips, and of the places we tried this was easily the best.  Light crispy batter, juicy fish (not overcooked), and crispy fries as well.  Our food came so quickly it was hard to believe, considering how busy they were.Average prices too.Our server was friendly.  The place was crazy and she had to leave her bar duties to serve us.  No problem at all for her.Can't say enough good things.  If you are attending the Borough Market, definitely grab some grub at the Southwark.

TLMRmnk1c6-AtWcBDBJgDA.text: We came upon the tavern and needed a drink & food.Perfect spot.We got our pints & fish & chips, steak sandwich. TheFood was very good., and so was the beer.Upstairs has some tables but the real fun is downstairs. In a dungeon like setting we occupied Cell #4. Every  table was reserved for the evening. Seems to be a very busy place between 6-9PMWe came between lunch-dinner so had ample of seating selectionStaff was very friendly.I'll go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Steak Sandwich
Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Fish & chips
Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom

mb7gz86oCAbl-of6g4T4jA.text: Half of their beer taps were down when I went, but they still had bottles and happy hour wine. Grab a pint, and go sit outside. Buy some chorizo flavored crisps as well. They're delicious.

RIeeIKcT01KTWhjC0k5M1Q.text: Nice for a quick stop on a warm day. They have some rotating taps for craft beer and a full menu. I had to try their take on onions rings. They were different from what I was used to in the US ; lighter and crisper. I liked them.Visited August 2016

GlgNdm-hSjhw32eUolBd6g.text: This is a local drinking spot/pub.Came here for dinner and they had a nice selection of beers cocktails and menu items to choose from. Excellent service and attentive staff.  Need to order the drinks and the food at the bar and they will bring it to you.A feel good place with a good beer and meal.

3-lXdZrpxPT3HSg-cTwWZA.text: Cozy tavern with comfy underground seating. Had fish & chips which both could have used a bit more salt, but the sauces more than made up for it. The rest of the menu, and what I saw on other guests' plates and in their reactions, looked very enticing as well, so I'll say the kitchen knows what they're doing. Add a good pint of beer, and you have a happy customer. In fact, I stayed for 2 more pints after that, so there...Recommended!

S2D_-O3MGHG9xRTh3Xj0HQ.text: This is one of my favourite places to go during a midweek drink with my bestie. London Bridge is a good half way point for us, and we always just end up here. I used to be put off because it always looks HELLA busy on the outside, but if you head in and downstairs there is usually somewhere to sit.There are also the cells which are my favourite place to hide. I love pubs with dark corners!You can book tables, the food is good, the beer is flowing and the bar staff are usually pretty friendly.It's a general all round good pub experience in the centre of town.

iRwz76j8D6S7U1Cm6FxLCQ.text: What a wonderful breakfast spot, we dropped by today just before 12 and wasn't sure if they were still doing breakfast. The staff behind the bar responded positively that yes breakfast menu was still being served. We both went for the full English breakfast  without black pudding and a glass of OJ. The food was cooked and served fairly quickly the only points that could have made it wonderful would be if the butter was a bit more spreadable and if they served better OJ. Overall a lovely atmosphere in this pub and certainly would consider heading back for breakfast again.

0z7V58LT4lFXmQ3n3IMpFg.text: Went on a Tuesday evening and was surprised how busy it was, considering this was a normal week in April.. not Easter, or Bank Holiday time. Only stayed for a quick drink, and the service was slow due to how busy the pub was. Prices are standard for central London. Inside, the place is decorated to keep its traditional feel, with modern twists. Overall, a pleasing place for a quick drink but there are other pubs close by with more unique features making this one just above average.

jz_qs1-oXhexKQ0_9g9kTg.text: I had lunch here after moseying around Covent Garden. It was a great place to escape the rain and grab a pint!

nJHjfS9uGK3ThKEdtKQahQ.text: I was waiting to see if London Bridge was gonna fall down, but I got tired of waiting. Must eat, me hungry! A short stride away from the infamous bridge, this tavern served its purpose. The bartender is efficient but not the friendliest chap. No matter, the 2 course 10 euros prix fix menu is sure to take care of things. The salt and pepper squid with lime mayo was thinly battered and had a soft bite to it. My smoked trout-egg salad had a nice ratio of protein and fresh veggies. Bf's beer battered haddock and chips were fairly decent, the fish was a bit bland but the crispiness made up for it, well, that and the malt vinegar we doused it with. On the other hand, chips were pretty good. Better as a place to stop by for a pint or two, or if you fancy wine, they have a chalkboard list on the wall as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Smoked trout-egg salad

Vh1m7dnHwCqTiSUk9QOv7Q.text: This place is really fun, lively, and social.  The vibe is really friendly, and downstairs, they have fun, more private cellar booths that are great if you're feeling something a little more romantic or quieter.  Great place for a pint, and I would highly recommend it!

uI7MTmcysPsvdBHu9Z-pZQ.text: The Southwark Tavern is a strange place. Located just off Borough High Street, at the edge of Borough Market it makes for a busy pub. I came on a Friday night at about 9pm and there was diverse crowd of City workers, tourists and people out for a big night. A very convenient place to meet people, I think it would be better in the summer than a rainy February night..

Q9i3XyEzDEGPXLfmky6PNg.text: I went here last Sunday before lunch for my friend's bday and it was fairly busy for a late Sunday lunchtime but not massively so. Think it seems more so because space wise it seems so tight. Had a nice glass of wine in there and would probably return. Quick and friendly service. Very handy location on the edge of Borough Market and one of the Southwark tube entrances so handy for there and London Bridge.

3Kui_1_z1w5wrEQnuF0EcQ.text: The Southwark Tavern is the kind of pub where you just want to meet with some work colleagues or friends and have a quick pint before heading off on a big night out or just home after a long day. The selection of beers is quite good with a lot of craft beers on tap however the service is anything but desirable. Be prepared to wait a small eternity before being served, even when there is no other customers at the bar...

87tCobjVjFwUoZXbLI0o0Q.text: Just stopped by for a beer . If you want the English experience and you're from America or somewhere else , stop by and have a Timothy Taylor brew . Great staff !

photos.caption: Photo of Southwark Tavern - London, United Kingdom. Timothy Taylor

DOmLzu1isy6v3GiWQ_2rEA.text: This is a nice pub with good food and a good atmosphere. It almost gets a little too busy at times so if you want a seat I would get there early, but it's in a great location with a view of the Shard, there's a little bit of space to stand outside and the food and drinks are reasonably priced. The food is good too...if you want a proper meal there is a seated area downstairs which helps you avoid the crowds of drinkers, but it's often full so again, leave yourself some time.
